title: What BTS song do you like the least? - Quora

response.answer_text: Dionysus Now I know a lot of people LOVE this song. But you see, my personality is really chill and laid back. I’m not the OH YEAH LET’S PARTY kind of person. When I first listened to Dionysus, I was like, wth? When I found out so many people LOVED it, I decided to give it another try, but I just couldn’t finish it. I don’t particularly like fast-paced songs or songs with jazzy feels or trumpets and that stuff. Singularity I’m sorry, the lyrics are, no doubt, amazing. But Tae’s voice (I’m sorry bae) is too deep for my liking. It has a very ‘Jazz’ feeling to it, which I don’t like. Fake Love (at first listen) Y’all ’bout to be real mad at me. BUT. I really thought the song had one of the best structures ever: Starting with an unexpected DEEP VOICEImmediately going into the chorus (which isn’t really popular, most songs have a pre-chorus)Breaking it down with RM’s rapFake Love is structured in a way that keeps your heart going up and down. It’s like riding a wave. And that’s how it’s supposed to be-like a play with emotions. However, I really didn’t like it when they went ‘Love you so bad, love you so bad’. I really disliked that part. No offense, but to me it kinda sounded like they ran out of ideas and decided to put that part in so that the song was longer. But when it continues to the part ‘Mould a lie…’ THOSE lyrics I understand. But the whole part was a no no (in terms of melody and the lyrics) for me. But this is the song where we got RM’s ‘IDK, Nan Molla’Jin’s beautiful actingSuga’s hairJhope’s mirror thing with JKJimin’s blue contactsTaehyung’s deep voiceJungkook’s AbsDope and Fire (for the same reasons) The only parts I didn’t like in this song was Jhope’s parts. In Fire, I didn’t like Jhope’s ‘Room Room’ and ‘hoo hoo’ in the first verse. In Dope, I didn’t like it when he made his voice go all teeny-tiny. I saw someone say one time that, “When you’re happy, you connect with the music; when you’re sad, you understand the lyrics”. I’m happy most of the time (Lmao I hope so) so, yeah, I tend to focus on the melody than the lyrics.

I wouldn’t necessarily say I hate them but I just get tired of listening to it or it doesn’t appeal to me. i got into bts for their music and my playlist was all their album which wasn’t very much because they were quite small at the time. Today, as they have released so many music, I can now make several judgments about which songs I don’t prefer or would skip over. Fake Love: this song is just so… repetitive? I hard a hard time listening to it especially the chorus. However, when I experienced this song at their last concert with fan chants is it was enjoyable chanting the fake love part! However, I can not listen to this song as much as the others.Run- also very repetitive, but again what songs are not repetitive these days? Lmao. I feel like RUN first stuck out to me, but I just lost interest in it. And the dance wasn’t my favorite!IDOL- the music video was cool, however, it sounded like something I heard before. But this songs gets lit in the concerts! And when you’re slowly getting into the song, I just can’t for some reason, listen to it voluntarily.DNA- IDK WHY I JUST DONT LIKE IT LOL. It’s not catchy to me, and The way they chose to arrange or sing of the lyrics was weird and the chorus was not as strong?Boy With Luv- I’m so sad bc I was quite disappointed when this came out. It just didn’t feel like them, and I thought it was due to them debuting in America, so yes I was expecting some change in their style! However, not to my liking. It’s that song where you’ll catch yourself humming to but you would tell others you don’t like the song. IT WAS THAT SONG. I still freak out when it comes on the radio but as I’m singing to it, i wish it would’ve been a different song that could’ve been on the radio instead.sorry for the crappy explanations, these 5 songs are just not my cup of tea! And everyone has those. I do love the majority of their songs. I also realize these are the ones that are promoted the most so therefore it makes sense if I get tired of listening to them because I always HEAR THEM lol!!! I also realize that these songs are more recent which explains why I prefer their old music so much haha. I still listen to their old albums till this day!
